subject: Critical Thinking
title: Overconfidence: The Most Dangerous Bias in Decisions
description: A 60-second lesson on Overconfidence: The Most Dangerous Bias in Decisions.

hook.text: Ask people to give 90% confidence intervals for questions. They're right about 50% of the time.

buildup.text: Overconfidence: our confidence in our knowledge and predictions consistently exceeds our actual accuracy.

discovery.text: It appears in three forms: over-estimation, over-placement, over-precision.

twist.text: CEOs, doctors, lawyers, & investors are all chronically overconfident.

climax.text: Calibration training helps: practice giving probabilities & checking them.

punchline.text: You're probably wrong more often than you think. Literally.

quiz.question: What is calibration in the context of decision-making?
options: Matching confidence levels to actual accuracy rates
